</TABLE>
</DIV>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Mobile Industries segment's net sales, excluding the effects of acquisitions, divestitures and foreign currency exchange rate changes, decreased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$47.6 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	or
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.8%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The decrease in net sales was primarily due to lower volume in the off-highway (primarily agriculture) and aerospace end market sectors, partially offset by organic growth in the rail and automotive sectors. EBIT was
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	lower
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primarily due to the impact of goodwill impairment and inventory valuation adjustments of $118 million recorded in 2014, a gain on the sale of Alcor of $29 million recorded in 2015, the benefit of lower raw material and operating costs net of manufacturing underutilization, lower SG&amp;A expenses and the impact of acquisitions. These factors were partially offset by a gain on the sale of real estate in Brazil of $23 million recorded in 2014, lower volume of $20 million and unfavorable price/mix of $14 million and the negative impact of foreign currency exchange rate changes of $18 million.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>

<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	31

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Process Industries segment's net sales, excluding the effects of acquisitions and foreign currency exchange rate changes,
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decreased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$43.5 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	or
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.1%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primarily due to lower volume in the industrial distribution, services and heavy industries end market sectors, partially offset by organic growth in the wind energy and military marine sectors. EBIT was lower in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primarily due to the impact of lower volume of $21 million, unfavorable price/mix of $24 million, the impact of unfavorable foreign currency exchange rate changes of $25 million and higher impairment and restructuring charges. These factors were partially offset by lower SG&amp;A expenses, the impact of lower material and operating costs net of manufacturing underutilization and the impact of acquisitions. EBIT also included a charge of $8.2 million in the fourth quarter of 2015 related to the write-off of certain CIP balances.&#160; Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 8 - Property, Plant and Equipment
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Corporate expenses
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decreased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primarily due to lower incentive compensation expenses and the impact of cost reduction initiatives.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	32
</SPAN>
</DIV>

	Accounts receivable, net, decreased as a result of lower sales in December 2016 compared with December 2015 and the impact of foreign currency exchange rate changes, partially offset by the impact of current year acquisitions.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</SPAN>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The increase in property, plant and equipment, net, in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	was primarily due to capital expenditures of $128.0 million and additions from current-year acquisitions of $16.6 million, partially offset by current-year depreciation of $95.5 million, the impact of foreign currency exchange rate changes of $15.4 million and impairment charges of $3.6 million.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A ID="SA4278ACA18945E8486BFE8376A190E4D">
</A>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in goodwill was primarily due to the acquisition of Lovejoy in the third quarter of 2016.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in non-current pension assets was primarily due a decrease in the discount rate used to measure the obligation for the Company's U.S. and U.K. defined benefit pension plans, which negatively impacted the funded status of these plans. See
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 14 - Retirement Benefit Plans
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in deferred income taxes was primarily due to purchase accounting adjustments, changes in tax rates and other deferred tax adjustments, partially offset by the impact of current year book-tax temporary differences including pension expense and depreciation.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in other non-current assets was primarily due to the reclassification of $18.6 million of tax payments in India to income taxes payable in order to apply these payments to the underlying liabilities to which they related during the third quarter of 2016.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	33
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in short-term debt was primarily due to the change in classification of the outstanding borrowings under the Accounts Receivable Facility in accordance with the terms of the agreement and the Company's expectations relative to the minimum borrowing base.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Current portion of long-term debt
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decreased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	due to the payment of medium term notes that matured during the third quarter of 2016, partially offset by the Company's 7.01% Fixed-rate Medium-Term Notes, Series A (2017 Notes) that will be repaid at maturity in November 2017.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in accounts payable was primarily due to higher days outstanding driven by the Company's initiative to extend payment terms with its suppliers.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in accrued salaries, wages and benefits was primarily due to lower expected retiree medical payments for the next twelve months, the elimination of one of the Company&#8217;s Canadian pension plans and the impact of lower headcount versus the prior year.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in income taxes payable reflects the current tax provision, less income tax payments, the reclassification of tax payments in India of $18.6 million and the reclassification of certain accruals for uncertain tax positions to non-current liabilities.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A ID="S10B7F07FE0F3507E926B6D28D20C4CF2">
</A>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in long-term debt was primarily due to the classification of $49 million of outstanding borrowings under the Accounts Receivable Facility in accordance with the terms of the agreement and the Company's expectations relative to the minimum borrowing base as long-term at
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared with zero as of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, along with an $8.6 million increase in borrowing under the Senior Credit Facility.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The increase in accrued pension cost was primarily due to a decrease in the discount rate used to measure the obligation for the Company's unfunded defined benefit pension plans.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in other non-current liabilities during
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	was primarily due to acquisition related expense of $4.1 million.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	34
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Earnings invested in the business in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	by net income attributable to the Company of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$152.6 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, partially offset by dividends declared of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$81.6 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in accumulated other comprehensive loss was primarily due to foreign currency translation adjustments of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$34.5 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and pension and postretirement liability adjustments of $0.6 million after tax. The foreign currency translation adjustments were due to the strengthening of the U.S. dollar relative to other foreign currencies, including the British Pound Sterling and the Chinese Renminbi Yuan, partially offset by increases related to the Brazilian Real. See
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Other Disclosures - Foreign Currency
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	" for further discussion regarding the impact of foreign currency translation. The increase in pension and postretirement liability adjustments was primarily due to a decrease in the discount rate used to measure the underlying pension obligation, mostly offset by pension settlement charges, amortization of actuarial gains and losses, an amendment to the Company's postretirement obligation and the impact of income taxes.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in treasury shares was primarily due to the Company's purchase of 3.1 million of its common shares for
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$101.0 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, partially offset by $13.9 million worth of net shares issued for stock compensation plans during
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	35
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Operating Activities:
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Operating activities
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	provided
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	net cash of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$402.0 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, after providing net cash of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$374.8 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The increase was due to the favorable impact of income taxes of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$227.8 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and a net favorable change in working capital items of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$13.3 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, partially offset by lower net income of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$212.4 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, excluding pension settlement charges. Refer to the tables below for additional detail of the impact of each line on net cash provided by operating activities.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following chart displays the impact of working capital items on cash during
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively:
</SPAN>
</DIV>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Investing Activities:
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net cash
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	used
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in investing activities of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$211.0 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decreased
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	from the same period in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primarily due to a
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$140.7 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in cash used for acquisitions, partially offset by a $46.2 million reduction in proceeds from divestitures, a
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$31.9 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increase
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in cash used in capital expenditures, and an $8.3 million reduction in proceeds from the sale of property, plant and equipment.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Financing Activities:
</SPAN>
</DIV>

</SPAN>

<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company presents net debt because it believes net debt is more representative of the Company's financial position than total debt due to the amount of cash and cash equivalents held by the Company.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, approximately $134 million, or over 90%, of the Company's $149 million cash and cash equivalents resided in jurisdictions outside the United States. It is the Company's practice to use available cash in the United States to pay down its Senior Credit Facility or Accounts Receivable Facility, in order to minimize total interest expense. As a result, the majority of the Company's cash on hand was outside the United States. Repatriation of these funds to the United States could be subject to domestic and foreign taxes and some portion may be subject to governmental restrictions. Part of the Company's strategy is to grow in attractive market sectors, many of which are outside the United States. This strategy includes making investments in facilities and equipment and potential new acquisitions. The Company plans to fund these investments, as well as meet working capital requirements, with cash and cash equivalents and unused lines of credit within the geographic location of these investments where possible.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Accounts Receivable Facility that matures on November 30, 2018. The Accounts Receivable Facility is subject to certain borrowing base limitations and is secured by certain domestic accounts receivable of the Company. Certain borrowing base limitations reduced the availability of the Accounts Receivable Facility to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$67.2 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	at
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, there were outstanding borrowings of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$48.9 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	under the Accounts Receivable Facility, which reduced the availability under this facility to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18.3 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The interest rate on the Accounts Receivable Facility is variable and was
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.65%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	as of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which reflects the prevailing commercial paper rate plus facility fees.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500.0 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Senior Credit Facility that matures on June 19, 2020. At
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had outstanding borrowings of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$83.8 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which reduced the availability to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$416.2 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Senior Credit Facility has
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	financial covenants: a consolidated leverage ratio and a consolidated interest coverage ratio. At
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company was in full compliance with the covenants under the Senior Credit Facility and its other debt agreements. The maximum consolidated leverage ratio permitted under the Senior Credit Facility is 3.5 to 1.0 (3.75 to 1.0 for a limited period up to four quarters following an acquisition with a purchase price of $200 million or greater). As of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company&#8217;s consolidated leverage ratio was 1.77 to 1.0. The minimum consolidated interest coverage ratio permitted under the Senior Credit Facility is 3.5 to 1.0. As of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company&#8217;s consolidated interest coverage ratio was 11.37 to 1.0.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	37
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#TKR10K123116_HTM_S263B3F8258DE5FE5B4544D857C3DB3E2">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Table of Contents
</SPAN>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The interest rate under the Senior Credit Facility is variable with a spread based on the Company&#8217;s debt rating. The weighted-average borrowing rate was
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.50%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	as of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In addition, the Company pays a facility fee based on the consolidated leverage ratio multiplied by the aggregate commitments of all of the lenders under the Senior Credit Facility.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Other sources of liquidity include short-term lines of credit for certain of the Company&#8217;s foreign subsidiaries, which provide for borrowings up to approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$202.7 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Most of these credit lines are uncommitted. At
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had borrowings outstanding of $
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19.2 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and guarantees of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.9 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which reduced the availability under these facilities to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$181.6 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company expects that any cash requirements in excess of cash on hand and cash generated from operating activities will be met by the committed funds available under its Accounts Receivable Facility and the Senior Credit Facility. Management believes it has sufficient liquidity to meet its obligations through at least the term of the Senior Credit Facility.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company expects to remain in compliance with its debt covenants. However, the Company may need to limit its borrowings under the Senior Credit Facility&#160;or other facilities in order to remain in compliance. As of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company could have borrowed the full amounts available under the Senior Credit Facility and Accounts Receivable Facility, and would have still been in compliance with its debt covenants.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2014, the Company issued $350 million aggregate principal amount of fixed-rate unsecured notes that mature in September 2024 (the "2024 Notes"). The Company used a portion of the net proceeds from this issuance to repay the $250 million aggregate principal amount of fixed-rated unsecured notes that matured on September 15, 2014.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company expects cash from operations of approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$310 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in 2017, a decrease from
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$92 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	or
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	23%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, driven by lower net income (including no expected CDSOA receipts), lower benefit from working capital and higher income tax payments. The Company expects capital expenditures of approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of sales in 2017, compared with
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of sales in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	38
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	500.4
</SPAN>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The interest payments beyond five years primarily relate to long-term fixed-rate notes. Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 10 - Financing Arrangements
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Purchase commitments are defined as an agreement to purchase goods or services that are enforceable and legally binding on the Company. Included in purchase commitments above are certain obligations related to take or pay contracts, capital commitments, service agreements and utilities. Many of these commitments relate to take or pay contracts, in which the Company guarantees payment to ensure availability of products or services. These purchase commitments do not represent the entire anticipated purchases in the future, but represent only those items that the Company is contractually obligated to purchase. The majority of the products and services purchased by the Company are purchased as needed, with no commitment.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In order to maintain minimum funding requirements, the Company is required to make contributions to the trusts established for its defined benefit pension plans and other postretirement benefit plans. The table above shows the expected future minimum cash contributions to the trusts for the funded plans as well as estimated future benefit payments to participants for the unfunded plans.&#160; Those minimum funding requirements and estimated benefit payments can vary significantly. The amounts in the table above are based on actuarial estimates using current assumptions for, among other things, discount rates, expected return on assets and health care cost trend rates. Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 14 - Retirement Benefit Plans
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and&#160;
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 15 - Postretirement Benefit Plans
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company made cash contributions of approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	to its global defined benefit pension plans. The Company currently expects to make contributions to its global defined benefit pension plans totaling approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in 2017. Returns for the Company&#8217;s global defined benefit pension plan assets in
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;were 8.50%, above the expected rate of return of 6.0% predominantly due to&#160;increases in the long duration fixed-income markets. The higher returns positively impacted the funded status of the plans at the end of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. However, due to a 35 basis point reduction in the discount rate used to measure the Company's U.S. defined benefit pension obligations and a 125 basis point reduction in the discount rate used to measure its U.K defined benefit pension obligations, the higher returns were largely offset. Despite the negative impact of the lower discount rates, the Company expects slightly lower pension expense, excluding pension settlement charges, in future years. Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 14 - Retirement Benefit Plans
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 15 - Postretirement Benefit Plans
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 11 - Contingencies
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 17 - Income Taxes
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information regarding the Company's exposure for certain legal and tax matters.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31, 2016
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company had approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$39.2 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of total gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160;The Company believes it is reasonably possible that the amount of unrecognized tax positions could decrease by approximately
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	during the next 12 months. The potential decrease would be primarily driven by settlements with tax authorities and the expiration of various statutes of limitation.&#160;Future tax positions are not known at this time and therefore not included in the above summary of the Company&#8217;s fixed contractual obligations. Refer to
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Note 17 - Income Taxes
</SPAN>
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for additional information.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company does not have any off-balance sheet arrangements with unconsolidated entities or other persons.
</SPAN>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<SPAN STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	39
</SPAN>
</DIV>
